SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.nttdocomo.io
Interface HttpConnection

All Superinterfaces:
javax.microedition.io.Connection, javax.microedition.io.ContentConnection, javax.microedition.io.InputConnection, javax.microedition.io.OutputConnection, javax.microedition.io.StreamConnection
public interface HttpConnection
extends javax.microedition.io.ContentConnection

The following defines network connection using the HTTP protocol.

Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the connection and releases resources.

Specified by:
close in interface javax.microedition.io.Connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException - I/O Generated when an I/O error has occurred.

openInputStream

public java.io.InputStream openInputStream()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Obtains an input stream. Obtains a reference to an instance of the InputStream object for reading content data of a response message (body of an HTTP message) from the server. When multiple InputStreams are obtained simultaneously, the behavior shall be inplementation dependent on the UE. When a response message from the server is normally completed and there is no content data to be read, a blank stream shall be returned.

When this method is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Specified by:
openInputStream in interface javax.microedition.io.InputConnection
Returns:
A reference to an instance of the InputStream object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Generated when an I/O error has occurred.
ConnectionException - Generated when a communication error has occurred.

openOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream openOutputStream()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Obtains an output stream. Obtains a reference to an instance of the OutputStream object for reading content data of a response message (body of an HTTP message) from the server. When multiple OutputStreams are obtained simultaneously, the behavior shall be dependent on the UE implementation. When the connect method is called before calling the close method for the OutputStream, the status of the OutputStream object shall be undefined. When nothing is written in, the content data shall be empty.
When this method is called after calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Specified by:
openOutputStream in interface javax.microedition.io.OutputConnection
Returns:
A reference to an instance of the OutputStream object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Generated when an I/O error has occurred.
ConnectionException - Generated when a communication error has occurred.

connect

public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException
Connects via HTTP and sends and receives messages. This method sends a request message with a designated content header information to a designated URL at the opening of a connection, and waits until a response message is received.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - Generated when an I/O error has occurred.
ConnectionException - Generated when the header setting is inadequate (Ex.: request method is not designated) or when a communication error has occurred (ILLEGAL_STATE).
ConnectionException - Generated when the response code from the server is not 2xx (HTTP_ERROR).
InterruptedIOException - Generated when the status shifts to suspension or when a disconnect request has occurred.

getLength

public long getLength()
Obtains the length of the content. When "Content-Length" is included in the HTTP response header, the header value shall be obtained as the length.
When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Specified by:
getLength in interface javax.microedition.io.ContentConnection
Returns:
An integral value indicating the length of the content. When there is no applicable header, "-1" shall be returned.

getType

public java.lang.String getType()
Obtains the identification character string of the content type. When "Content-Type" is included in the HTTP response header, the header value is returned as the character string. This method is the same as getHeaderField ("Content-Type").
When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Specified by:
getType in interface javax.microedition.io.ContentConnection
Returns:
A character string indicating the content type. When there is no applicable header, null shall be returned.

getEncoding

public java.lang.String getEncoding()
Obtains the identification character string of the content encoding format. When "Content-Encoding" is included in the HTTP response header, the header value shall be obtained as the character string. This method is the same as getHeaderField("Content-Encoding").

When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Specified by:
getEncoding in interface javax.microedition.io.ContentConnection
Returns:
A character string indicating the content encoding format. When there is no applicable header, null shall be returned.

getHeaderField

public java.lang.String getHeaderField(java.lang.String name)
Obtains the header information. Obtains a header value of a designated header name of the HTTP response header.
When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Parameters:
name - Designates a character string that indicates a key value of the header.
Returns:
A character string indicating the header value. When there is no designated header, null shall be returned.

getURL

public java.lang.String getURL()
Obtains the URL of the connection destination. Obtains the URL character string designated when opening this connection.

Returns:
A character string indicating the URL of the connection destination.

setRequestMethod

public void setRequestMethod(java.lang.String method)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Sets a request method. Sets a method of a request message for the server. It must be either "HEAD," "GET," or "POST."
When this method is called after calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Parameters:
method - Designates a character string indicating an HTTP request method.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the parameter "method".
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a method that has not been permitted is designated for the parameter "method".
java.io.IOException

setRequestProperty

public void setRequestProperty(java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String value)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Sets a value for a header property. Sets a header of an HTTP request message. The settable property value is either "Content-Type" or "If-Modified-Since." When there is no value or when a property that has not been permitted is designated, this method shall not operate.
When this method is called after calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Parameters:
key - Designates a character string that designates a property.
value - Designates a value to be set.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Generated when an I/O error has occurred.

getExpiration

public long getExpiration()
Sets a value for the "If-Modified-Since" header. public String getResponseMessage() throws IOException; /** Obtains the expiration date of the message. When "Expires" is included in the HTTP response header, the header value is obtained as the expiration date. The value is the number of milliseconds measured since January 1, 1970 (GMT).
When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Returns:
An integeral value indicating the date. When there is no header, "0" shall be returned.

getDate

public long getDate()
Obtains the date of the message. When "Date" is included in the HTTP response header, the header value is obtained as the date. The value is the number of milliseconds measured since January 1, 1970 (GMT).
When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Returns:
An integeral value indicating the date. When there is no header, "0" shall be returned.

getLastModified

public long getLastModified()
Obtains the update time of the message. When "Last-Modified" is included in the HTTP response header, the header value is obtained as the update time. The value is the number of milliseconds measured since January 1, 1970 (GMT).

When this is called before calling the connect method, RuntimeException or another exception of its subclass shall be generated.

Returns:
An integral value indicating the time. When there is no header, "0" shall be returned.
